There was once a girl named Emmy. She always wanted to visit her grandmother in another town. But her father was dead and her mother was too lazy to travel...

One day, Emmy decided to travel to her grandmother's town against her mother's wishes. 'I have my rights! You can't bind me to this house,' she said to her mother. Her mother could not resist against the human rights and allowed her daughter to go...

She had to pass through a forest in order to reach to her grandmother's town. It was a dense and dark forest, but her determination to see her grandmother gave her courage. After a few miles into the woods, she heard a whisper...

It was a rat whispering her. 'Hey girl, you want some candies?' was the rat's proposition. Emmy knew too well to never accept candies from strangers. The rat started approaching to show the candies, but Emmy sent forth a sudden kick. The rat flew into a tree and got glued to it...

Emmy left the smashed rat there and moved further. Then came another whisper: 'Hey girl, you want some cheese?' It was a raccoon this time. Emmy's parents never warned her about eating cheese from strangers and she was also quite hungry...

She accepted the cheese and devoured it in seconds. The raccoon smiled and ran away into the forest's darkness. Emmy could not even thank him. But she did not want to lose anymore time and continued on her way...

After several minutes, Emmy began to feel a pain in her stomach. At first, she tried to ignore it, but the pain gradually increased and became unbearable. She had to sit down. Then came back the raccoon...

'You see, young girl, I have tricked you with my cheese. It was filled with candies,' said the vile raccoon. Emmy knew that she made a fatal mistake. She ate candies from a stranger! 'Please, help me!' she begged...

'I wanted to teach you a lesson, little girl. In this life, there are cheeses filled with candies everywhere. You should always be careful about the cheese. Now drink this antidote.' said the raccoon, handing her a vial of antidote...

Emmy drunk the antidote and got better in mere seconds. She thanked to the raccoon for his life lesson and continued her journey. Then she instantly died! That antidote was actually poison! THE END Wow! You spent years to read this silly book.
